author: Aris Folley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Friday called on Congress to raise the nation’s debt ceiling by mid-July to keep the federal government from defaulting on its more than $36 trillion debt. In a letter to Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.), Bessent said that there is “reasonable probability” that the government’s “cash and extraordinary measures will be…
title: Bessent urges Congress to act on debt limit by mid-July

author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: Sen. Tom Cotton (R-Ark.) introduced a bill Friday that would require chip exports to have location-tracking systems to prevent American technology from reaching adversaries. The bill, titled the Chip Security Act, would direct the Commerce Department to require a “location verification mechanism” on artificial intelligence chips subject to export controls. Chip exporters would then be…
title: Cotton unveils legislation requiring location verification for advanced AI chip exports

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Immigration advocates are suing on behalf of Afghans and Cameroonians set to lose protections from deportation after the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said it plans to let their Temporary Protected Status (TPS) expire. “Each designation was first made in 2022, in response to the prolonged armed conflicts, hunger, and human rights abuses afflicting both…
title: DHS sued over lifting deportation protections for Afghans, Cameroonians

author: Kai Boysan, opinion contributor
description: Congress should update 49 U.S.C. § 5323(r) to define "reasonable access" for intercity bus providers to public transportation facilities, ensuring equity, access and interoperability across modes and unlocking the full potential of America's transportation network.
title: Congress has a chance to make intercity buses great again

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Most Americans are opposed to President Trump’s handling of college campuses, according to a poll released Friday. The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research survey found that 56 percent disapprove of Trump’s push to restructure higher education.  The survey results come as Education Secretary Linda McMahon has revoked funding from Harvard University and Columbia…
title: Most opposed to Trump’s handling of colleges: Survey

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Former Waste Management CEO David Steiner has been appointed as the next postmaster general of the U.S. Postal Service, despite concerns from the National Association of Letter Carriers union about his connections to FedEx and potential conflicts of interest.
title: Ex-Waste Management CEO David Steiner tapped to lead Postal Service

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: The USPS reported a $3.3 billion net loss in the latest quarter, largely due to federal worker benefits and other unfunded liabilities, but the agency is working to control costs and increase revenues as it faces economic headwinds.
title: Postal Service facing ‘economic headwinds,’ reports $3.3B loss

author: David Walker, opinion contributor
description: DOGE did some noteworthy work — but it overpromised, underdelivered and has grossly overstated its financial savings accomplishments.
title: Grading DOGE: Some achievements, several mistakes

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Supreme Court Justice Sonia Sotomayor urged lawyers Thursday to defend the judiciary amid verbal attacks from the Trump administration due to recent rulings.  “Our job is to stand up for people who can’t do it themselves. And our job is to be the champion of lost causes,” Sotomayor said during a Thursday event for the…
title: Sotomayor urges lawyers to ‘stand up’ amid Trump attacks

author: Jose Mallea, opinion contributor
description: Congress must extend the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 to keep the American Dream alive for Latino communities, which it has helped to lift incomes, create jobs and stimulate the economy.
title: Extend Trump’s tax cuts to keep the American Dream alive

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: America’s big three automakers ripped President Trump on Friday over his newly announced trade deal with the United Kingdom.  The Thursday agreement is the first bilateral trade pact for the administration since it rolled out and then paused a “reciprocal” tariff regime on many of America’s main trading partners. The British auto industry expressed excitement…
title: US automakers rip Trump trade deal with UK

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Columbia University student and Palestinian activist Mohsen Mahdawi said Columbia’s response to pro-Palestinian protesters storming the library was inciting more violence.   On Wednesday, Columbia called in the NYPD and arrested 80 students after they stormed the school’s library, injured two employees, carved “Columbia will burn” into framed pictures and would not leave or identify…
title: Freed student: Columbia inciting violence with response to pro-Palestinian protest

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Former “Meet the Press” moderator and NBC News analyst Chuck Todd knocked former President Biden over what he said was a willingness to prioritize himself over the Democratic Party’s success. “If you’re a party man, you worry about your party before yourself,” Todd said Thursday while appearing on NewsNation’s “On Balance,” noting he had previously…
title: Chuck Todd: Bidens more interested in themselves than Democratic Party

author: Nicole Tidei, opinion contributor
description: On Military Spouse Appreciation Day, let’s do more than say thank you. Let’s remove the barriers that hold spouses back and create real opportunity for a workforce that’s more than ready to serve.
title: Military spouses are ready to work — policymakers must help make it possible

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: President Trump plans to put Ed Martin, his first pick for U.S. attorney in Washington, D.C., who was rebuffed by the Senate, in a far-reaching role at the Justice Department. In a Thursday evening post on his social media site, Trump said Martin would serve as both the head of a new Weaponization Working Group…
title: Trump taps Martin for DOJ pardon attorney, ‘weaponization’ role

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. in a Thursday interview said President Trump’s new nominee for surgeon general turned away from modern medicine because “she was not curing patients.” Surgeon General nominee Casey Means, an ally of Kennedy’s “Make America Healthy Again” movement, has come under scrutiny as she never finished her…
title: RFK Jr.: Casey Means ‘walked away from traditional medicine because she was not curing patients’

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Retired Supreme Court Justice David Souter died Thursday, the court announced. He was 85.  The court’s announcement did not list a cause of death but said Souter “died peacefully” at home in New Hampshire, where he has lived since stepping down from the court.  “Justice David Souter served our Court with great distinction for nearly twenty…
title: Retired Supreme Court Justice David Souter dies at 85

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump spoke late Thursday with French President Emmanuel Macron after Trump called for Russia and Ukraine to agree to a 30-day ceasefire or face potential sanctions. Macron posted on the social platform X that he spoke “several times” with Trump and praised his “strong call for an unconditional 30-day ceasefire, as did our British…
title: Macron says he spoke with Trump, praises call for 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. in a Thursday interview did not directly answer a question about a statement his former running mate gave about him saying he’s being “controlled,” but described himself as a health “renegade.” The battle concerns President Trump’s new nominee to serve as surgeon general, Casey Means, an…
title: Kennedy describes himself as a ‘renegade’ when asked if he’s being controlled

author: Amanda Kavanagh | This Column was created by Jobbio
description: You remember “quiet quitting” and “quiet firing”, right? Both have been dominant workplace trends over the last five years. Quiet quitting refers to employees who do the bare minimum required by their job descriptions, avoiding extra hours, volunteering, or going beyond their assigned tasks. It gained widespread attention during the pandemic as workers reassessed their…
title: Are you “quiet cracking” at work?

author: Liz Peek, opinion contributor
description: After a few months of celebrating Donald Trump’s astonishing political comeback by offering the president near-unanimous support, Republicans are going squishy.
title: Republicans need to grow a spine and support Trump’s agenda

author: Aron Solomon, opinion contributor
description: At the end of the day, a democracy can survive bad drivers. What it can’t survive is nobody driving at all.
title: Trump’s chaotic government is no accident — it’s strategic neglect

author: Chris Truax, opinion contributor
description: Everyone can see that Grandpa Trump has become a menace, but no one is doing anything to limit the damage, much less to take his car keys away. Sooner, rather than later, there’s going to be a terrible accident.
title: What is Trump even doing any more?

author: Chris Stirewalt
description: On the menu: Trust fall; Mule mail; Greene at the gills; Beshear not bashful; The _____ Nate Moore  America’s obsession — or at least the American media’s obsession — with the election process that gave the world Pope Leo XIV has been intense. It’s been great #content. I mean, Cardinal Pizzaballa? How could they resist?…
title: Whole Hog Politics: Looking for the Catholic coalition in American politics

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Pope Leo XIV celebrated his first mass in the Sistine Chapel on Friday morning, just a day after being elected to replace the late Pope Francis as the leader of the Catholic Church. The new pope, born Robert Francis Prevost in Dolton, Ill., spoke in Spanish, Italian and English during the homily. “You have called…
title: Pope Leo XIV celebrates first Mass at Sistine Chapel

author: Nicholas Sargen, Opinion Contributor
description: The U.S. may avoid a recession this year, but the risk of one increases the longer the trade war lasts.
title: Even without a recession, Trump’s tariffs will be painful

author: Dave Trabert and David Hoyt, Opinion Contributors
description: Some state education departments are still resisting certifying the elimination of diversity, equity, and inclusion programs.
title: The DEI era harmed non-white students most, yet some states won’t end it

author: Jordan Perkins
description: The shooting at Abundant Life Christian School in Madison, Wisconsin, left two people dead.
title: Father of Wisconsin school shooter arrested, charged

author: Tobias Burns
description: President Trump announced a trade agreement with the U.K. on Thursday, the first country-specific deal since the April 2 “Liberation Day” import taxes that raised the overall U.S. tariff rate to the highest level in more than a century. The U.K. deal is meant to be the first of many for Trump, and comes as…
title: 5 things to know about Trump’s UK trade pact

author: Julia Manchester
description: Democrats are blasting former President Biden’s reemergence in the spotlight following his interview Thursday on “The View,” his second major post-presidency interview.  During the sit-down, which took place alongside former first lady Jill Biden, Biden slammed President Trump’s second administration, saying he’s had “the worst 100 days any president’s ever had.” The former president also…
title: Democrats fume over Biden’s return to spotlight

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Peace Corps staffers are bracing for deep cuts at the agency, ones they fear will do untold damage to one of the last remaining programs promoting development and fostering goodwill abroad.  Employees at the agency have been told to expect “significant restructuring efforts” as  Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) staffers begin to assess the agency.…
title: Peace Corps braces for deep cuts under Trump

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Teacher Appreciation Week this year is taking place under a shadow of uncertainty for those navigating political waters while trying to ensure students get the education they need.   K-12 schools are navigating book bans and running into state laws barring diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) and transgender athletes. College professors are watching as billions…
title: This Teacher Appreciation Week, educators are feeling threatened in new ways

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Kathleen Kennedy Townsend, the niece of former President John F. Kennedy, who was the first Roman Catholic U.S. president, reflected on Pope Leo XIV’s first speech as a pontiff.  Former Maryland Lt. Gov. Kennedy Townsend, who is the eldest daughter of the late U.S. Attorney General and U.S. Sen. Robert F. Kennedy, said his words…
title: Kathleen Kennedy Townsend says Pope Leo XIV’s welcoming first speech an ‘important message at this time’

author: Rachel Scully
description: The brother of Robert Prevost, now Pope Leo XIV, said the newly elected pontiff will likely follow in the late Pope Francis’s footsteps to serve and look out for “those who don’t have a voice.” John Prevost, one of Robert’s two brothers, said that Francis and Leo were “two of a kind,” noting that his…
title: Brother says Pope Leo XIV will likely follow Francis and look out for ‘those who don’t have a voice’

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: President Trump recently switched his nomination for Surgeon General but his first pick, Dr. Janette Nesheiwat, will continue to work at the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS).   HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr said during a Thursday interview with Fox News’ Bret Baier that the administration will put Nesheiwat in “a very…
title: Trump’s first pick for surgeon general to still work for HHS

author: Filip Timotija
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has directed the Department of Defense (DOD) to start removing transgender troops from the military in early June if they do not exit voluntarily, according to a new memo.  Hegseth outlined in the Thursday memo that transgender active service members are eligible to “separate voluntarily” until June 6 and could be…
title: Hegseth memo sets swift timeline to get transgender troops out of military

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A Massachusetts man was charged on Thursday with the attempted assassination of a Cabinet member nominee and carrying a dangerous weapon on the Capitol grounds after being arrested in late January.  Ryan English, 24, brought two Molotov cocktails and a knife onto the property in an effort to kill Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent prior to…
title: Massachusetts man charged with attempt to assassinate Cabinet member
